## Outline

- What is the Complutensian polyglot Bible? Start with [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complutensian_Polyglot_Bible).
- What is the digital edition this package works with?
    - "standard" texts of the Masoretic text, Vulgate, Septuagint and Targum Onkelos.  (On [github](https://github.com/neelsmith/compnov))
    - original transcriptions of the Latin glosses on the Septuagint and Targum Onkelos. (On [github](https://github.com/neelsmith/complutensian-texts))
- What are the primary goals of the project that this package supports?
    - aligning features of language across versions
- What is the focus of work in this early stage of development?
    - parse all Latin and Greek texts morphologically and align verbal expressions across documents
- What are immediate next goals?
    - develop a Hebrew morphological parser to extend the alignments to Latin, Greek and Hebrew
